abstract: The Impact GC3502 computer from Everex, $298, consumes less power than the average desktop computer, potentially saving money on the monthly electric bill as well.
snippet: The Impact GC3502 computer from Everex, $298, consumes less power than the average desktop computer, potentially saving money on the monthly electric bill as well.
lead_paragraph: Tuition and other academic fees are plenty expensive, but a new desktop PC may take some of the financial sting out of the fast-approaching back-to-school shopping spree. The Impact GC3502 from Everex has a list price of $298, and its 1.5-gigahertz VIA C7-D processor consumes less power than the average desktop computer, potentially saving money on the monthly electric bill as well.

headline.main: A Desktop PC That’s Short on Bells and Whistles, but Long on Savings
headline.print_headline: A Desktop PC That’s Short On Bells and Whistles, But Long on Savings
